trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: After enabling Azure Key Vault Integration, you can enable SQL Server encryption on your SQL VM.
trans-unit.target: After enabling Azure Key Vault Integration, you can enable SQL Server encryption on your SQL VM.

trans-unit.source: First, you will need to create an asymmetric key inside your key vault and a symmetric key within SQL Server on your VM.
trans-unit.target: First, you will need to create an asymmetric key inside your key vault and a symmetric key within SQL Server on your VM.

trans-unit.source: Then, you will be able to execute T-SQL statements to enable encryption for your databases and backups.
trans-unit.target: Then, you will be able to execute T-SQL statements to enable encryption for your databases and backups.

trans-unit.source: There are several forms of encryption you can take advantage of:
trans-unit.target: There are several forms of encryption you can take advantage of:

trans-unit.source: Transparent Data Encryption (TDE)
trans-unit.target: Transparent Data Encryption (TDE)

trans-unit.source: Encrypted backups
trans-unit.target: Encrypted backups

trans-unit.source: Column Level Encryption (CLE)
trans-unit.target: Column Level Encryption (CLE)

trans-unit.source: The following Transact-SQL scripts provide examples for each of these areas.
trans-unit.target: The following Transact-SQL scripts provide examples for each of these areas.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Each example is based on the two prerequisites: an asymmetric key from your key vault called **CONTOSO_KEY** and a credential created by the AKV Integration feature called **Azure_EKM_TDE_cred**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Each example is based on the two prerequisites: an asymmetric key from your key vault called **CONTOSO_KEY** and a credential created by the AKV Integration feature called **Azure_EKM_TDE_cred**.

trans-unit.source: Transparent Data Encryption (TDE)
trans-unit.target: Transparent Data Encryption (TDE)

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Server login to be used by the Database Engine for TDE, then add the credential to it.
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Server login to be used by the Database Engine for TDE, then add the credential to it.

trans-unit.source: Create the database encryption key that will be used for TDE.
trans-unit.target: Create the database encryption key that will be used for TDE.

trans-unit.source: Encrypted backups
trans-unit.target: Encrypted backups

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Server login to be used by the Database Engine for encrypting backups, and add the credential to it.
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Server login to be used by the Database Engine for encrypting backups, and add the credential to it.

trans-unit.source: Backup the database specifying encryption with the asymmetric key stored in the key vault.
trans-unit.target: Backup the database specifying encryption with the asymmetric key stored in the key vault.

trans-unit.source: Column Level Encryption (CLE)
trans-unit.target: Column Level Encryption (CLE)

trans-unit.source: This script creates a symmetric key protected by the asymmetric key in the key vault, and then uses the symmetric key to encrypt data in the database.
trans-unit.target: This script creates a symmetric key protected by the asymmetric key in the key vault, and then uses the symmetric key to encrypt data in the database.

trans-unit.source: Additional resources
trans-unit.target: Additional resources

trans-unit.source: For more information on how to use these encryption features, see [Using EKM with SQL Server Encryption Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn198405.aspx#UsesOfEKM).
trans-unit.target: For more information on how to use these encryption features, see [Using EKM with SQL Server Encryption Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn198405.aspx#UsesOfEKM).

trans-unit.source: Note that the steps in this article assume that you already have SQL Server running on an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Note that the steps in this article assume that you already have SQL Server running on an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If not, see [Provision a SQL Server virtual machine in Azure](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-portal-sql-server-provision.md).
trans-unit.target: If not, see [Provision a SQL Server virtual machine in Azure](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-portal-sql-server-provision.md).

trans-unit.source: For other guidance on running SQL Server on Azure VMs, see [SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines overview](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-classic-sql-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For other guidance on running SQL Server on Azure VMs, see [SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines overview](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-classic-sql-overview.md).
